result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

14CF24 and 14CF126 - Defendant Brian L. Nickel in court with attorney William Andrew Mayer.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim appears by phone.  Joint stipulation given to Court.  Court reviews rights and penalties.  Def. pleads N/C to Count 2 - Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm.  Court reviews PQWR.  Court finds Def. makes plea freely and voluntarily.  Court finds Def. guilty of Count 2 in Case 14 CF 24 - Child Abuse - Recklessly Cause Harm.  Remaining two counts in Case 14 CF 24 and Case 14 CF 126 DRI.  Victim makes statement.  Attorney Sempf heard.   Attorney Mayer heard.  Defendant does not make a statement.  Court heard and sentence is imposed:  

Sentence W/H
3 years probation
20 days DCJ commencing 11/15/14 with H&T
AODA and any follow thru
No presence at any establishment whose primary business involves the dissemination of alcohol
Maintain absolute sobriety
Defendant to only have contact with the children as allowed under the Order set in the family case 08FA322 and with permission of probation agent
Court costs
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 1, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Brian L. Nickel in court with attorney William Andrew Mayer.  Intern Holdahl w/James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 10 days mtns; bail con't; scheduled w/JT in 14CF24 on 10/1/14 at 8:30 in Br 4.  Jury trial scheduled for October 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant, Brian L. Nickel in court, Yolanda J Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions defendant; Atty Mayer was court appoint on another matter; Court heard and will appoint Atty Mayer on this matter also; Court orders payments adjusted to $100/mo commencing 6/1/14; prelim to remain on calender; bail con't

Defendant, Brian L. Nickel in court, Robert G Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested within time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets cash bond at $250 with conditions:  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 22, 2014 at 03:00 pm.  Review hearing scheduled for May 14, 2014 at 08:15 am.
